availability.p: The text of the original item is in the public domain. The text encoding and editorial notes were created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). notesStmt.note: No image of verso currently available. According to the New York Public Library, the verso is blank; however, notes on one or more soldiers can be seen through the leaf, including details about reading and illness.

This manuscript was likely composed between January and mid-March 1863. Union soldiers Charles Miller and Levi Haas were wounded at Fredericksburg (December 11–15, 1862) and were in Armory Square hospital in early 1863. Justus Boyd was out of the hospital and writing to Whitman by March 10, 1863.
The following are responsible for particular readings or for changes to this file, as noted: Elizabeth Lorang Ashley Lawson Tim Jackson

bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: A Series of Washington Hospital Notes. Written at the bedsides of wounded soldiers. Washington, 1863–1865.

body.ab: take (Marg. D Valois) for Justus F. Boyd, bed 22, Ward I, paper & envelopes
Levi Haas (something) bed 38, I some money
Chas Miller bed 19, Ward I some apples—also tobacco (also one to each of the boys each side)
John Reichard (bed 32, Ward G) an orange
N.Y. Relief Association, Penn. av. cor 7th.
call for bottle of brandy for Mrs. Reynolds, ward F. (Massachusetts, same building)
